intro: Scyphostelma tenellum, commonly known as the slender star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to dry and well-drained conditions. Scyphostelma tenellum is a perennial species that produces showy blooms during the summer months.
